metadata.title: Eating the Rainbow: A Spectrum of Health Benefits
metadata.description: "Eat a Rainbow" can sound like a regular health advisory but the physiological science behind it holds a greater significance. Apart from being visually appealing, each hue of fruits and vegetables represents a unique set of phytochemicals that offer various powerful health benefits. These natural compounds besides their distinctive taste and aroma, play key roles in reducing inflammation, improving vision, strengthening immunity, and lowering the risk of chronic diseases like cancer, heart disease, and diabetes. It can also improve the much disturbed sleep cycle in this social media addict world. While individual colors have their own benefits, the real magic happens when a variety of colors are combined on the plate. This diversity of colours supports a healthier gut microbiome and the fiber content which strengthens the immune system. Research has from time to time proven that adding color diversity to the diet, increases longevity. In today’s fast-paced world, simply adding more color to the meals can be one of the easiest and most enjoyable steps toward long-term wellness. It’s a vibrant, delicious, and simple path to a healthier, more energized life.

creators.name: Eating the Rainbow: A Spectrum of Health Benefits

data.title: Eating the Rainbow: A Spectrum of Health Benefits

metadata.title: Critical Study of the Indian Constitution, Its Core Values, and the Influence of Literature
metadata.description: The Indian Constitution is a visionary document that lays the foundation of a sovereign, socialist, secular, and democratic republic. It enshrines core values like justice, liberty, equality, and fraternity which guide the nation’s governance and social structure. These values are not confined to the legal framework alone but have found vibrant expression in Indian literature. Writers like B.R. Ambedkar, Premchand, Mahadevi Verma, and Mulk Raj Anand, among others, have played a pivotal role in articulating constitutional ethics through literature. This paper critically analyzes the interrelationship between the Constitution, its values, and the role of literature in reflecting and shaping these ideals.

journal.title: International Journal of Advance and Applied Research

data.title: Critical Study of the Indian Constitution, Its Core Values, and the Influence of Literature

metadata.title: National Education Policy 2024: A Comprehensive Perspective
metadata.description: Abstract: The National Education Policy (NEP) 2024 represents a paradigm shift in India’s educational framework, building on the foundational reforms of NEP 2020 and aiming to establish a learner-centric, inclusive, and future-ready education system. This policy envisions an integrated approach to learning that spans from early childhood education to higher education and lifelong learning. It emphasizes universal access, equity, quality, and global competitiveness, while remaining deeply rooted in India's cultural and intellectual heritage. NEP 2024 introduces a restructured school system through the 5+3+3+4 model and proposes significant reforms in curriculum, pedagogy, assessment, and teacher training. Holistic development, experiential learning, multilingual education, competency-based assessments, and multidisciplinary pathways are cornerstones of the new approach. The policy recognizes the transformative role of educators and prioritizes continuous professional development and mentoring. Technology integration, digital literacy, and flexible learning modalities are central to achieving equitable access, particularly in underserved and remote regions. The policy also fosters internationalization, research excellence, and employability through vocational education and modular degrees supported by the Academic Bank of Credit. Governance reforms include the establishment of regulatory bodies like the Higher Education Commission of India (HECI), the State School Standards Authority (SSSA), and the National School Standards Authority (NSSA) to ensure accountability and quality assurance. While the policy faces challenges in implementation—such as infrastructural constraints, financial needs, and institutional resistance—it also presents a unique opportunity to harness India’s demographic dividend by empowering youth with relevant skills, values, and global perspectives. If implemented effectively, NEP 2024 has the potential to transform India into a vibrant knowledge society and a global education leader.

creators.name: Kumari, Punam
creators.affiliation: CIL/SLL&CS, Jawaharlal Nehru University, New Delhi – 110067

keywords: NEP 2024, education reform, inclusive learning, digital literacy, interdisciplinary education, competency-based assessment, demographic dividend, teacher empowerment, lifelong learning, India

data.title: National Education Policy 2024: A Comprehensive Perspective

metadata.title: A Strategic Framework for Branding Kannur District as  an Emerging Tourism Destination
metadata.description: Kannur District in Kerala possesses diverse tourism assets – scenic beaches, lush wildlife, rich cultural heritage (e.g. Theyyam ritual arts and historic forts) and emerging eco-tourism sites like Aralam Sanctuary. Yet it remains underbranded compared to Kerala’s iconic locations. This empirical study (combining recent tourism statistics and stakeholder perspectives) examines trends and proposes a strategic branding framework. Data from Kerala Tourism (2021–2023) show that Kannur’s domestic tourist arrivals surged from 346,406 to 854,838 post-pandemic, while foreign arrivals rose from 81 to 2,431. However, challenges include limited international awareness and infrastructure gaps (e.g. parking, safety) identified in visitor surveys. The proposed framework emphasizes product development (highlighting Kannur’s beaches like Payyambalam, Muzhappilangad, heritage forts; Theyyam festivals and Aralam eco-trails), marketing strategies (integrated digital and traditional campaigns, leveraging the “God’s Own Country 2.0” wellness/eco-tourism narrative), infrastructure enhancements (upgrading transport, facilities and leveraging Kannur International Airport), and stakeholder engagement (community-based and Responsible Tourism initiatives). The framework aligns with Kerala’s 14th Five-Year Plan vision of PPP-driven district tourism hubs. By integrating recent visitor data, local surveys, and planning guidelines, this study offers actionable steps to position Kannur as a vibrant emerging destination.

journal.title: International Journal of Contemporary Research in Multidisciplinary

data.title: A Strategic Framework for Branding Kannur District as  an Emerging Tourism Destination

metadata.title: 25. सिनेमा में कृत्रिम बुद्धिमत्ता का युगः नई संभावनाएँ और चुनौतियाँ
metadata.description: Cinema is a rich and vibrant art form that has not only been entertaining people for more than a hundred years, but also remains an effective medium to express society, culture and ideologies. It is not just an audio-visual medium, but a social document that reflects the changing lives, thoughts and experiences with time. The biggest feature of cinema is its wide reach and effectiveness. It has the ability to connect with all types of audiences, crossing the boundaries of any language, caste, religion, class or region. Whether it is a social message, historical events, human emotions or contemporary problems—cinema presents them effectively. Thus, cinema is not only an art, but it is also a medium of social consciousness, cultural mirror and emotional dialogue.

creators.name: MUTHTHARASI – Art Literary Culture Tamil Journal

keywords: : cinema, artificial intelligence, entertainment, society, technological development, screenwriting, editing, virtual reality, creativity, film industry, ethical challenges, cultural impact.

metadata.title: 03. L'animation française et les femmes cinéastes célébrer les forces créatrices du cinéma contemporain
metadata.description:
Abstract
This article will explore two important aspects of contemporary French cinema: the vibrant world
of French animation and the impactful contributions of women filmmakers. Each section will examine the unique characteristics, key films, and cultural significance of these two dynamic areas of the French film industry.
French animation has become a significant force in the global film industry, known for its artistic innovation, emotional depth, and unique storytelling. With a rich history dating back to the early 20th century, France has cultivated a vibrant animation scene that continues to captivate audiences worldwide. This article explores the contemporary landscape of French animation, highlighting the key films and trends that define this dynamic art form.

creators.name: MUTHTHARASI – Art Literary Culture Tamil Journal

metadata.title: 30. நெய்தல் வாணிகம்
metadata.description: This article explores the traditional maritime trade practices of the Neithal (coastal) landscape, one of the five ancient ecological zones (Thinai) described in classical Tamil literature. Neithal represents the coastal regions characterized by proximity to the sea, fishing communities, salt production, and vibrant trade activities. The article highlights how ancient Tamils engaged in both inland and overseas trade, utilizing ports, ships, and barter systems, thereby showcasing their advanced commercial acumen. References from Sangam literature, archaeological evidence, and historical records reveal the significance of Neithal trade in shaping Tamil culture and economy. This study emphasizes the importance of revisiting and understanding Neithal trade practices in the context of present-day economic and cultural revival.

creators.name: MUTHTHARASI – Art Literary Culture Tamil Journal

keywords: Passage — Transportation by sea - Cargo — Goods or merchandise - Ocean — Sea (a waterway used for trade) - Storm — Severe winds and weather conditions in the sea - Trader — A merchant or trader engaged in trade

metadata.title: 03.Maritime trade in Sangam literature
metadata.description:
Sangam literature vividly portrays the flourishing sea trade of ancient Tamilakam, highlighting its pivotal role in shaping 
the region's economy and culture. The texts reveal extensive maritime networks connecting Tamil lands with distant shores like 
Sri Lanka, Southeast Asia, and the Arabian Peninsula. Merchants traded spices, precious gems, textiles, and aromatic goods, 
showcasing Tamil expertise in navigation and commerce. Sea trade fostered prosperity, leading to the rise of wealthy port cities 
and vibrant cultural exchanges. The Sangam poets celebrate the courage of sailors and the allure of the ocean, reflecting the 
deep bond between the people and the sea. This maritime commerce not only enriched Tamil society materially but also enhanced its  political and diplomatic stature. Sangam works such as Purananuru and Pathinenkilkanakku immortalize the grandeur and significance of sea trade. The literature honours the adventurous spirit of traders who braved the vast ocean to establish far cosmopolitan outlook. It stands as a timeless testament to the ancient Tamil mastery over the seas and commerce.

creators.name: MUTHTHARASI – Art Literary Culture Tamil Journal

keywords: Passage — sea route - Cargo — cargo - Ocean — sea - Storm — sea-borne wind - Crossroads — merchant

metadata.title: Open Journal System as critical knowledge infrastructure: Supporting "Open Access" from a Latin American standpoint
metadata.description: This paper examines the sociotechnical dynamics of a key technical infrastructure supporting Latin America's Open Access movement, the Open Journal System (OJS). Contrasting with the increasing adoption of Article Processing Charges (APCs) in the Anglo-European publishing space, the text highlights Latin America as a region committed to Diamond Open Access, where vibrant publishing communities support and approach, where neither authors nor readers pay nor to read or publish. This paper assesses the landscape of existing journals running OJS by repurposing installation data and parsing it with metadata from the Directory of Open Access Journals (DOAJ). Using a mixed methods approach, it leans on ethnographic research and repository analysis to present a description of key sociotechnical dynamics that support development and adoption in the region. Results discuss the key role of higher education institutions in supporting OA infrastructures, but show the limitations for keeping installations active in the region. The piece illustrates the value that intermediate layers have in supporting the translation of Open Access to local publishing cultures and, vice versa, translating local requirements to orient the development processes. These results have implications for the understanding of the sustainability of digital publishing and scientific infrastructure in the region, while stressing the key role of OJS in specific research domains.

grants.title: Disciplinary Improvements: The SEEKCommons Research Coordination Network

data.title: Open Journal System as critical knowledge infrastructure: Supporting "Open Access" from a Latin American standpoint

metadata.title: 22nd International Conference on Near Infrared Spectroscopy, NIR 2025 - Book of Abstracts
metadata.description: The 22nd International Conference on Near Infrared Spectroscopy - NIR2025, organized by the Italian Society of NIR Spectroscopy (SISNIR) in collaboration with the International Council on Near Infrared Spectroscopy (ICNIRS), was held in Rome from June 8–12, 2025. The event brought together leading scientists, industry experts, and stakeholders to present and discuss the latest developments in NIR spectroscopy, including advances in methodology, instrumentation, and diverse applications. The conference featured keynote lectures, full and flash contributed talks, poster sessions, and a vibrant exhibition area showcasing cutting-edge technologies.

data.title: 22nd International Conference on Near Infrared Spectroscopy, NIR 2025 - Book of Abstracts
